intro: Eremanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eremanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Eremanthus angustifolius is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
